DOC.brief_summary: Background : We perform prospective clinical study compare post-operative recovery profile patient transperitoneal retroperitoneal laparoscopic nephrectomy technique . Our primary aim compare post-operative epidural analgesic consumption transperitoneal ( Group T ) retroperitoneal ( Group R ) laparoscopic nephrectomy patient within first 24 hour . Methods : Forty-four patient schedule elective transperitoneal retroperitoneal laparoscopic nephrectomy enrol . All patient group receive epidural catheter , 2.5ml test dose lidocaine 2 % general anesthesia induction . At end surgery , patient give 1g IV paracetamol 10ml 0.25 % bupivacaine epidural catheter extubated . In post-operative care unit , patient start receive continuous infusion 0,1 % bupivacaine 1µg/ml fentanyl 5ml/h patient-controlled bolus additional 4ml patient control epidural analgesia ( PCEA ) device . They prescribe IV tramadol 1mg/kg rescue analgesic ( Visual analog scale ( VAS ) ≥4 ) . Total analgesic consumption PCEA device , VAS score rest mobilization , heart rate ( HRs ) , systolic ( SBPs ) /diastolic blood pressure ( DBPs ) extubation ( 0th min-basal ) post-operative 30th min , 2nd , 6th , 12th , 18th 24th hour well number patient require rescue analgesic record . Nausea , vomit , time first mobilization , return bowel sound hospital stay also document .
